column5:
This week please download R and Rstudio
Show Diana or Chante your dataset, and
Complete a tutorial introduction to Rstudio

Introductions - roll call
Today we will cover the R and Rstudio platform.   .

column4: Introduction to R and R studio
column9:

https://ourcodingclub.github.io/tutorials/intro-to-r/

column5: "Nailed it!" What have you learned, attempted, or acomplished

Today we will explore how to get started.  Diana and I will demonstrate one method, over time you'll have your own process.  We will learn some best practices that are used by other coders as a statrting point for developing your own structure. In groups, you will practice developing an outline for your project and then begin to examine your dataset to identify what your outline would be. Then you'll open your own data, take a look at it and identify what needs to be changed.
"Nailed it!" What have you learned, attempted, or acomplished
We are going to focus on manipulating your dataset.  You will begin to tidy your dataset so that it will be in a format that can be easily used in R.

column4: Getting Started with Rmarkdown.  There are two videos that accompany the material we'll cover today.  You'll only need to watch the first 8 mins of the second video for our needs today, but the whole thing is useful.
